result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Joseph Grabowski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Benjamin Joseph Grabowski.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Defense counsel advises that parties are still in negotiations and are requesting an adjourned plea/sentencing date. No objections from the State. Court grants request and adjourns case to Br 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and offer.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.SPD Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court by video.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD to appoint Attorney Richardson pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Benjamin Joseph Grabowski
Current: 816 W Greenfield Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 04-29-2022)
Prior: 345 East Warnimont Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53207
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin Joseph Grabowski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
